comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Something happened in "Miles Buildings" - a view or famous inhabitant - can't remember who or when . . .

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Rear of Miles Buildings Cumberland St. [Sydney] (c.1901) [SLV: H42656, b28037] Miles Buildings (rear) Cumberland Street (November 1933)* [SLNSW: d1_21668] [*note: the date the photograph was re-photographed]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Remembered! John Degotardi (Senior) photographed a panorama of "Sydney and Port Jackson (from Myles' [sic] Buildings, Cumberland Street Nth" in ca. 1865-1868. According to the blurb Mrs L. Myles' house was at 34 Cumberland St, which I think is one of these back entrances. acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/item/itemDetailPaged.aspx?itemID=440028#

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Full caption for this image is "Gloucester st / Miles Buildings/ Where Edmund Barton was born". Hence important person born was Edmund Barton, Australia's first Prime Minister. Australian Dictionary of Biography states born 18 Jan 1849 at Glebe adb.anu.edu.au/biography/barton-sir-edmund-toby-71. JS

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: ... where Edmund Barton lived as a child. "Edmund Barton was born on 18 January 1849 in Hereford Street, Glebe, in Sydney. Two years later the Bartons moved to Cumberland Street in The Rocks, and when he was seven ‘Toby’ Barton was enrolled at the nearby Fort Street Model School." - primeministers.naa.gov.au/primeministers/barton/before-of...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Aha!  As Australia's first Prime Minister, Edmund Barton would have been on the mind of the photographer / annotator in 1901.  The title also shows a keen interest in the history of what was about to be destroyed.  Maybe even concern for the destruction of "Old Sydney", like the artists?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence)
